englishTranslationText:
What	are	they	questioning	each	other	
about?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	āpas	meiñ	kāhe	ki	pooch	gāch	kar	rahe	
haiñ

englishTranslationText: About	the	great	tidings!
romanUrduTranslationText: Badi	khabar	ki

englishTranslationText: Regarding	which	they	hold	different	views.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	meiñ	woh	kayi	rāh	haiñ

englishTranslationText: Surely	yes,	they	will	soon	come	to	know!
romanUrduTranslationText: Hañ	hañ	ab	jān	jāyeñge.

englishTranslationText:
Again	surely	yes,	they	will	soon	come	to	
know!
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	hañ	hañ	jān	jāyeñge

englishTranslationText: Did	We	not	make	the	earth	a	bed?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	ham	ne	zameen	ko	bichaunā	na	
banāya?

englishTranslationText: And	the	mountains	as	pegs?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	pahārdoñ	ko	mekheñ

englishTranslationText: And	it	is	We	who	created	you	in	pairs.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tumheñ	jode	banāyā

englishTranslationText: And	made	your	sleep	a	rest.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tumhāri	niñd	ko	āarām	kiyā

englishTranslationText: And	made	the	night	a	cover.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rāt	ko	parda	posh	kiyā

englishTranslationText: And	made	the	day	for	seeking	livelihood.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	din	ko	rozgār	ke	liye	banāyā

englishTranslationText: And	built	seven	strong	roofs	above	you.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāre	oopar	sāt	mazboṭ	chunāiyāñ	
chuniñ	(ta’ameer	kiñ)

englishTranslationText: And	have	kept	a	very	bright	lamp	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	meiñ	aik	nihāyat	chamaktā	
charāgh	rakhā

englishTranslationText:
And	then	sent	down	hard	rain	from	the	
water	bearing	clouds.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bhāri	badliyoñ	se	zor	kā	pāni	utārā

englishTranslationText: In	order	to	produce	grain	and	plants	with	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	us	se	paidā	farmāyeñ	anāj	aur	sabza

englishTranslationText: And	dense	gardens.		.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ghane	bāgh

englishTranslationText: Indeed	the	Day	of	Decision	is	a	time	fixed.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	faisle	kā	din	thahrā	huā	waqt	hai.

arabicText: يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجًۭا
englishTranslationText: The	day	when	the	Trumpet	will	be	blown	–	you	will	therefore	come	forth	in	multitudes.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	din	soor	phoñkā	jāye	gā	to	tum	chale	āaoge	faujoñ	ki	faujeiñ.

englishTranslationText: And	the	heaven	will	be	opened	-	it	therefore	becomes	like	gates.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	āsmān	kholā	jāyegā	ke	darwāze	ho	jāye	gā.

englishTranslationText: And	the	mountains	will	be	moved	-	they	will	therefore	become	like	mirages.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	pahārd	chalāye	jāyeñ	ge	ke	ho	jāyeñ	ge	jaise	chamaktā	retā	door	se	pāni	kā	dhokā	detā

englishTranslationText: Indeed	hell	is	lying	in	ambush.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	Jahannam	tāk	meiñ	hai

englishTranslationText: The	destination	of	the	rebellious.
romanUrduTranslationText: Sarkashoñ	kā	thikānā.

englishTranslationText: They	will	remain	in	it	for	ages.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	meiñ	qārnoñ	(muddatoñ)	raheñge

arabicText: لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْدًۭا وَلَا شَرَابًا
englishTranslationText: They	will	neither	taste	anything	cool	in	it,	nor	anything	to	drink.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	meiñ	kisi	ṭaraḥ	ki	thandak	kā	mazā	na	pāyeñge	na	kuch	peene	ko

englishTranslationText: Except	hot	boiling	water	and	hot	pus	discharged	from	the	people	of	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	khaultā	pāni	aur	dozakhiyoñ	kā	jaltā	peep.

englishTranslationText: The	reward	to	each	is	according	to	what	he	is.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jaise	ko	taisā	badla

englishTranslationText: Indeed	they	had	no	fear	of	the	account.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	unheñ	hisāb	kā	khauf	na	thā

englishTranslationText: And	they	denied	Our	signs	to	the	extreme.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Hamāri	Āyateñ	ḥad	bhar	jhutlāyiñ

englishTranslationText: And	We	have	kept	recorded	everything	in	a	Book,	accounted	for.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Ham	ne	har	cheez	likh	kar	shumār	kar	rakhi	hai

englishTranslationText: Therefore	taste	it	now	–	We	shall	not	increase	anything	for	you	except	the	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	chakho	ke	Ham	tumheñ	na	badhāyeñge	magar	‘ažāb.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	the	place	of	success	is	for	the	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	dar	wāloñ	ko	kāmyābi	ki	jagah	hai

englishTranslationText: Gardens	and	grapes.
romanUrduTranslationText: Bāgh	meiñ	aur	angoor

englishTranslationText: And	gorgeous	maidens,	of	single	age
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	uthte	joban	wāliyāñ	aik	'umr	ki.

englishTranslationText: And	an	overflowing	cup.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	chalaktā	jām

arabicText: لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًۭا وَلَا كِذَّٰبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
In	which	they	shall	neither	hear	lewd	talk,	
nor	any	lie.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	meiñ	na	koyi	behooda	bāt	suneñ	aur	na	
jhutlānā

englishTranslationText:
A	reward	from	your	Lord	-	an	infinitely	
sufficient	bestowal.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sila	tumhāre	Rab	kiṭaraf	se	nihāyat	kāfi	
'aṭā

arabicText: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۖ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَابًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Lord	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth,	and	all	
whatever	is	between	them	-	the	Most	
Gracious	-	with	Whom	no	one	will	have	the	
right	to	talk.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	Rab	hai	āsmānoñ	ka	aur	zameen	ka	
aur	jo	kuch	in	ke	darmiyān	hai	Raḥmān	ki	
us	se	bāt	karne	kā	ikhtiyār	na	rakheñ	ge

arabicText: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ صَفًّۭا ۖ لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	day	when	Jibreel	and	all	the	angels	will	
stand	in	rows;	none	will	be	able	to	speak	
except	one	whom	the	Most	Gracious	
commands	and	who	spoke	rightly.	
(Prophet	Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	
be	upon	him	–	will	be	the	first	to	be	granted	
permission	to	intercede.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	Jibreel	khadā	hogā	aur	sab	Farishte	
parā	bāñdhe	(safeñ	banāye)	koyi	na	bol	
sake	gā	magar	jise	Raḥmān	ne	ižn	diyā	aur	
us	ne	thik	bāt	kahi

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا
englishTranslationText:
That	is	the	True	Day;	therefore	whoever	
wills	may	take	the	path	towards	his	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	sachchā	din	hai	ab	jo	chāhe	apne	Rab	
ki	ṭaraf	rāh	banā	le

arabicText: إِنَّآ أَنذَرْنَـٰكُمْ عَذَابًۭا قَرِيبًۭا يَوْمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلْكَافِرُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى كُنتُ تُرَٰبًۢا
englishTranslationText:
We	warn	you	of	a	punishment	that	has	
come	near;	a	day	on	which	man	will	see	
what	his	own	hands	have	sent	ahead,	and	
the	disbeliever	will	say,	“Alas	–	if	only	I	
were	dust!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	tumheñ	aik	'ažāb	se	darāte	haiñ	ke	
nazdeek	āa	gayā	jis	din	āadmi	dekhe	gā	jo	
kuch	us	ke	hāthoñ	ne	āage	bhejā	aur	kāfir	
kahe	ga	hāye	maiñ	kisi	ṭaraḥ	khāk	ho	jātā

englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	those	who	harshly	pull	out	the	soul.	(Of	the	disbeliever)
romanUrduTranslationText: Qasam	un	ki	ke	sakhti	se	jān	kheeñcheñ

englishTranslationText: And	who	softly	release	the	soul.	(Of	the	believer)
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	narmi	se	band	kholeñ

englishTranslationText: And	who	glide	with	ease.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	āasani	se	paireñ	(chaleñ)

englishTranslationText: And	who	quickly	present	themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	āage	badh	kar	jald	pahuñcheñ

englishTranslationText: And	who	plan	the	implementation.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	kāmki	tadbir	Kareñ	ke	kāfiroñ	par	zaroor	'ažāb	hogā

englishTranslationText:
On	the	day	when	the	trembling	one	will	tremble.	(The	disbelievers	will	certainly	taste	the	
punishment.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	din	thar	tharāye	gi	thar	tharāne	wāli

englishTranslationText: And	the	following	event	will	come	after	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	ke	piche	āaye	gi	piche	āane	wāli

englishTranslationText: Many	a	heart	will	flutter	on	that	day!
romanUrduTranslationText: Kitne	dil	us	din	dhadakte	hoñge.

englishTranslationText: Unable	to	lift	their	gaze.
romanUrduTranslationText: Āañkh	oopar	na	uthā	sakeñge

englishTranslationText: The	disbelievers	say,	“Will	we	really	return	to	our	former	state?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kāfir	kahte	haiñkyā	ham	phir	ulte	pāõñ	palteñge

englishTranslationText: “When	we	have	become	decayed	bones?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	jab	gali	hhaddiyāñ	ho	jāyeñge

englishTranslationText: They	said,	“So	this	return	is	an	obvious	loss!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole	yuñ	to	ye	palatnā	nirā	nuqsān	hai

englishTranslationText: So	that	is	not	but	a	single	shout.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	nahiñ	magar	aik	jhidki

englishTranslationText: So	they	will	immediately	be	in	an	open	plain.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jabhi	woh	khule	maidān	meiñ	āa	pade	hoñge

englishTranslationText: Did	the	news	of	Moosa	reach	you?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	tumheñ	Mūsā	ki	khabar	āayi?

arabicText: إِذْ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلْوَادِ ٱلْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
englishTranslationText:
When	his	Lord	called	him	in	the	holy	valley	
of	Tuwa.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	usey	us	ke	Rab	ne	pāk	jangal	ṭuwā	meiñ	
nidā	farmāyi.

arabicText: فَقُلْ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“Tell	him	‘Do	you	have	the	inclination	to	
become	pure?’
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	se	kah	kyā	tujhe	raghbat	is	ṭaraf	hai	ke	
suthrā	ho

englishTranslationText:
‘And	I	may	guide	you	to	your	Lord,	so	that	
you	may	fear.’	”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tujhe	tere	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	rāh	batāoñ	ke	tu	
dare

englishTranslationText: So	Moosa	showed	him	a	magnificent	sign.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	Mūsā	ne	usey	bahut	badi	nishāni	
dikhāyi

englishTranslationText: In	response,	he	denied	and	disobeyed.
romanUrduTranslationText: Is	par	us	ne	jhutlāyā	aur	nā-farmāni	ki.

englishTranslationText: He	then	turned	away,	striving	in	his	effort.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	peeth	di	apni	koshsish	meiñ	lagā

englishTranslationText: So	he	gathered	the	people,	and	proclaimed.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	logoñ	ko	jam’a	kyā	phir	pukārā.

englishTranslationText:
And	then	said,	“I	am	your	most	supreme	
lord.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	bolā	main	tumhārā	sab	se	ooñchā	Rab	
huñ

englishTranslationText:
Allah	therefore	seized	him,	in	the	
punishment	of	this	world	and	the	
Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Allāh	ne	usey	duniyā	wa	Ākhirat	donoñ	
ke	‘ažāb	meiñ	pakrdā.

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةًۭ لِّمَن يَخْشَىٰٓ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	in	this	is	a	lesson	for	one	who	fears.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	us	meiñ	seekh	(sabaq)	miltā	hai	
usey	jo	dare

arabicText: ءَأَنتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ ۚ بَنَىٰهَا
englishTranslationText:
Do	you	think	that	it	is	harder	to	create	you	
or	the	heavens?	Allah	has	created	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tumhāri	samajh	ke	muṭābiq	tumhārā	
banānā	mushkil	yā	āasmān	kā	Allāh	ne	
usey	banāyā.

englishTranslationText: He	raised	its	roof	and	made	it	proper.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	ki	chat	ooñchi	ki	phir	usey	theek	kiyā

englishTranslationText:
And	He	made	its	night	dark,	and	started	its	
light.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ki	rāt	andheri	ki	aur	us	ki	raushni	
chamkāyi

englishTranslationText: And	after	it	spread	out	the	earth.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	is	ke	b’ad	zameen	phailāyi

englishTranslationText:
And	from	it	produced	its	water	and	its	
pasture.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	meiñ	se	us	kā	pāni	aur	chāra	nikālā

englishTranslationText: And	solidified	the	mountains.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	pahādoñ	ko	jamāyā
